# ALPS
## Any Light Particle Search
# Any Light Particle Search
## Any Light Particle Search
[ ![](https://alps.desy.de/sites/sites_desygroups/sites_extern/site_alps/content/e101047/ALPS-Gesamt-Logofarbig_small.jpg) ](https://alps.desy.de/sites/sites_desygroups/sites_extern/site_alps/content/e101047/ALPS-Gesamt-Logofarbig_big.jpg)
### We are
a research group of [DESY's particle physice research division](https://particle-physics.desy.de/) located in Hamburg.
### We seek what the universe is made of
We are interested in very light particles which can point the way toward unknown physics phenomena, like e.g. the dark matter in the Universe. Our current experiments, [ALPS II](https://alps.desy.de/our_activities/axion_wisp_experiments/alps_ii), [IAXO](https://alps.desy.de/our_activities/axion_wisp_experiments/iaxo) and [MADMAX](https://alps.desy.de/our_activities/axion_wisp_experiments/madmax) are helping us to track down such lightweights of the subatomic world.
### We understand the impacts of new light particles
We develop theories including new light particles to describe our universe and missing pieces beyond the standard model of particle physics.
### We investigate in new technologies
We are pushing high precission long-baseline infrared interferometry and heterodyne sensing of very weak signals at ALPS II.
We are developing a detector system for extremely low-intensity infrared light to be used in the ALPS II experiment. This detection system is based on a quantum device called Transition Edge Sensor. We aim for being sensitive to a single infrared photon within a day.
We are working on cooling concepts for the test masses of future gravitational wave detectors and technologies to detected high frequency gravitational waves.
We are developing a pressure sensor with unique capabilities as a spin-off from our gravitational wave studies.
We are setting up a "cryoplatform" at DESY to provide a unique environment for larger scale experiments requiring liquid He cooling.
Special thanks for shaping this website to Zina Efchary.
